titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Laura Streett, Louise Loeb and Jared Berenholz

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Laura Streett April 2008..

did.head: Collection Summary
did.physdesc: 9 cubic feet (1 filing cabinet, 6 boxes, 3 framed items)

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Letters, manuscripts, speeches, poems, and other items, primarily resulting from an official connection with Vassar College, written by Vassar students, faculty or staff, or by persons of historical and cultural significance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Letters with some manuscripts, speeches, poems, and other items, primarily resulting from an official connection with Vassar College, written by Vassar students, faculty or staff, or by persons of historical and cultural significance.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Several items in the collection were separated from larger collections.

p.archref: The letters of many individuals were separated from the collection and added to the Mitchell Kennerley Papers, June 1984. These include letters from Randolph G. Adams, Arnold Bennet, John Carter, Arthur Davison Ficke, Frank Harris, Allan A. Jefferson, Peter McArthur, and Blanche Shoemaker Wagstaff.
The letters of Margaret Stanton Lawrence and Martha C. Wright were separated from the collection and added to the Elizabeth Cady Stanton Papers.
The letters of Eva March Tappan were separated from the collection and added to the Eva March Tappan Papers.
The letters of Marianne C. Moore and Mary W. Moore were separated from the collection and added to the Marianne Moore Papers, Dec 2022.
The letters of Amy Lowell were separated from the collection and added to the Amy Lowell Papers, Jan 2023.

Letters to Vassar College President Sarah Blanding from various individuals were separated from the collection and returned to the Vassar College Office of the President Records - Sarah Gibson Blanding Files, Feb 2025. Correspondents include: Marian Anderson, Elizabeth Bowen, Dorothy Canfield Fisher, J. Robert Oppenheimer, Eleanor Roosevelt, and Adlai E. Stevenson.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Updated by Gretchen Maslin and Jenna Effenberger, 2011-2012.
Updated by Emma Gronbeck, Feb 2023 - Feb 2025.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Completed and updated by Jared Berenholz, 2008.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: An artificial collection, collected over several decades by Vassar College Library staff. Some materials removed from larger collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Autograph Files, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

did.unittitle: Adams, John Quincy — including material on Paris peace treaty and national politics,
Beecher, Catherine E., to John H. Raymond,

did.physdesc: (1 postcard, 2 letters, 1 envelope with 3 assorted items including photograph)

did.unittitle: Blackwell, Dr. Emily — including material on excessive practice of ovariotomy and dangers to women from syphilitic husbands,
Boyd, Thomas — including material on work as screen writer in Hollywood (1931), being a father, World War I experiences, and other issues,
Buck, Pearl S. — including correspondence with Alma Lutz on equal rights amendment and Buck's writing and speaking work,

did.physdesc: (correspondence between Benson J. Lossing and Stephen Buckingham on women as trustees; 10 letters, 2 envelopes)

did.unittitle: Crippen, Ruth — including material on Red Cross work in France,
Davis, Bette — including material on using women's rights pioneers as film material,
Dickenson, Anna E. — including material on her speaking engagements and personal news,
Douglass, Frederick — including material on John H. Raymond's activities on behalf of fugitive slaves in Rochester,

did.physdesc: (1 letter, photocopy -- SEE Salmon Historical Collection for original)

did.unittitle: Fitzherbert, Maria Anne (Mistress of King George IV),
Garrison, William Lloyd — including material on women's rights,

p.emph: Includes material on life and people at Vassar College.

did.physdesc: (7 letters, 1 signed poem, 1 card, 1 signed photograph)
(5 letters, 1 copy, 1 envelope with speech enclosed)

did.unittitle: Howe, Julia Ward - signed print of "Battle Hymn of the Republic,"

did.physdesc: (6 letters, one handwritten copy of a letter, 1 postcard)

p.emph: Includes correpondence to Katherine Loring on having a case of the shingles, living arrangements in England, family affairs, American presidential politics, fire in Salem, Mass., European politics, literary events, Sarah Jewett, and Boston news.

did.unittitle: [unidentified person with the initials, C. L.],
Leonard, Clair (includes letters from Helen Maguire Muller),

p.emph: Note: Includes correspondence to her daughter Gitty Lowndes on family and social news.

did.physdesc: (1 letter, 1 page of comments on a lecture)
(45 letters, 4 envelopes, 3 copies, 1 funeral pamphlet, 1 cloth item)
(1 letter, 1 page excerpts from Congressional Record)
(1 letter, with accompanying letter from Israel Coe)

did.unittitle: Mott, Lucretia — including a letter received from Geo. Combe about reform activities in Scotland and European revolutions (1848) as well as material on writing requests, Rochester abolitionist activities, Frederick Douglass, work of Lucy Stone and Antoinette Brown, women workers and pay inequities, work among blacks,

Murray, Pauli — including material on her commencement address at Spelman College, her writing, experiences in Ghana (1961-1962), the antics of her dog, work at Yale, and fund raising to assist African law students,

p.emph: Letter to Eleanor Roosevelt urging her to support the equal rights amendment.

did.unittitle: Parsons, [Thomas William], "Poppies" illuminated manuscript (to Florence Cushing, VC 1874),
Peabody, Elizabeth Palmer — including material on prayer and preaching, spiritual and religious ideas, Church affairs in Boston, and Theodore Parker,

did.physdesc: (2 letters, 1 postcard, 1 galley proof sheet, 1 memo)

did.unittitle: Raymond, Charles A. — including material on on Vassar College and women's education,

did.physdesc: (110 letters, 7 telegrams, 1 postcard, 2 documents, 1 envelope, 1 photograph)
(1 signature, 2 illustrations, 2 copies of a letter)

did.unittitle: Salmon, Lucy M. — including material on Vassar College History Dept., labor issues, and personal news,
did.physdesc: (61 letters, 36 envelopes, 8 notes, 5 documents, 1 newspaper clipping)

did.unittitle: Seldes, Helen — including material on anti-fascism, political and social life in New York City, country life in Vermont, and a strike by Vermont marble workers,
Shaw, Charlotte Frances (wife of George Bernard Shaw),
Small, Fanny — including material on teaching music and social events at Vassar College,
Smith, B.B. (of Kentucky) — including material on incident involving a runaway slave's confrontation with his white mistress (owner),
Taylor, Kate Huntington (Mrs. James Monroe Taylor),
Thomas, M. Carey — including material on Bryn Mawr positions for Vassar graduates, the Association of Collegiate Alumnae, and committee positions,
Tolstoy, Leo — including material on religion, writing, non-violence as part of Christianity, Shakers and chastity, evils of patriotism, and his health. Also includes letters from E.H. Crosby,
Tolstoy, Sophie — including material on Leo's work among the Russian peasants (in French),
Underhill, Adelaide — including material on Vassar College Library affairs, salaries, and some personal issues,
Van Doren, Carl — including material on T.S. Eliot's poetry, Tom Boyd's death, Katherine Mansfield and Middleton Murray, publishing issues, and personal news, largely to Ruth Fitch (Mason)

did.physdesc: (33 letters, 36 envelopes, 22 Christmas greetings, 10 postcards, 1 pamphlet, 1 note, 1 telegram, 3 newspaper clippings, 1 book made by nephew)
(21 letters, 3 pages of notes, 1 article copy)

did.unittitle: Washington, George, to the Hebrew Congregation of Newport, RI, 1790,
Weld, Angelina Grimke — including material on her daughter attending Vassar,

did.physdesc: (1 document, 6 reprints of notes, 1 pamphlet, 1 envelope, 2 letters, 1 autobiographic note)

did.unittitle: Whitney, Mary W. — including material on Vassar College Observatory, woman's equality and men's dislike of independent women, and family and personal news,
did.physdesc: (18 letters, 1 poem, 1 page prose, 3 envelopes, 1 page notes)
(5 letters, 1 manuscript ("The Robin"), 1 envelope, 1 letter copy, 1 signed poem with photograph)

did.unittitle: Wilder, Thornton — including material on lecturing at Vassar, Spanish Theater, women's education, his work and research,

did.physdesc: (3 letters, 7 letter copies, 1 copy of The President's War Message)

did.unittitle: Wood, John H. — includes material on shoemaker apprenticeship and wages and living costs in Woburn, Mass.,

did.physdesc: (2 letters, 2 envelopes, 1 newspaper clipping, 1 transcript of toast at Alumnae Luncheon)
